comments: a(n)=[n*sqrt(2)]-[n/sqrt(2)], where [x]=greatest integer <=x. Indeed, the equation {(nearest integer to n/r) = [nr]-[n/r] for all n>=0} has exactly two solutions: sqrt(2) and -sqrt(2). - _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 18 2003Let s(n) = zeta(3) - sum{1/k^3, k = 1..n}.  Conjecture:  for n >=1, s(a(n)) < 1/n^2 < s(a(n)-1), and the difference sequence of A049473 consists solely of 0s and 1, in positions given by the nonhomogeneous Beatty sequences A001954 and A001953, respectively.  - _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 05 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
